intro: Launaea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf launaea, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, succulent stems. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, helping to reduce water loss in dry environments. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Launaea angustifolia is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitats.
